actingDirector.name: Muhammad Talha Asghar
actingDirector.designation: Assistant Professor / Acting Director Student Affairs

studentAffairs.description: Responsible for co‑curricular and extra‑curricular student activities, discipline and welfare; organizes events within and outside campus.
objectives: Provide opportunities for overall grooming and development
Enhance student potential in sports, literature, music, culture, arts, entrepreneurship and community development
Maintain liaison with industries for projects, visits, placements and internships
Arrange inter‑university events (Olympiad), Open House, Job Fair, Excursion Trips

jinnah.description: Fully furnished, ventilated rooms with indoor games, gymnasium, TV room and mosque at reasonable rates.

nusrat.description: Exclusive girls’ hostel with similar facilities.

swimmingPool.description: All‑weather indoor pool with regular water changes and maintained hygiene; available at nominal charges.

stadium.description: Laser‑levelled cricket ground (international pitch), football and hockey grounds, net practice area, volleyball court, futsal facility; used for HEC national events; athletic track planned.

gymnasium.description: State‑of‑the‑art gym in sports complex with separate timings; Aerobic Centre; additional gym in hostel.

nusratAuditorium.description: Air‑conditioned hall with multimedia/P.A. system for debates, dramas, exhibitions, scientific shows.

iqbalAuditorium.description: State‑of‑the‑art facility for conferences and seminars.

societies.name: Literary Society
societies.description: Encourages literary activities; organizes inter‑department and inter‑university debates, part of University Magazine editorial board.

societies.name: Creative Art Society
societies.description: Promotes artistic talents; holds art competitions, cultural events, exhibitions, funfairs and musical programs.

societies.name: Adventure & Social Welfare Society
societies.description: Raises environmental awareness; undertakes cleanliness and tree‑planting drives; organizes social events, excursions, trekking, paragliding.

societies.name: Sports Society
societies.description: Promotes sports via inter‑department competitions and encourages inter‑university participation; sports include basketball, football, cricket, hockey, volleyball, badminton, table tennis.

societies.name: Science Society
societies.description: Enhances scientific knowledge; organizes project competitions, exhibitions, quizzes, conferences, seminars; collaborates with IEEE, ASHRAE, ASME, SMEP.

societies.name: Character Building Society
societies.description: Fosters moral and ethical values via lectures, discussions and essay writing competitions.

societies.name: Girls Society
societies.description: Develops leadership in female students; organizes extra‑/co‑curricular activities; partners with Pink Ribbon for girls’ health awareness.

financialAssistance.description: Supports need‑cum‑merit scholarships and processes them; scholarships funded by university or external organizations.
programs: Ihsan Trust interest‑free loans via Meezan Bank

studentCounseling.description: Provides personal and group counseling; arranges professional psychological help from HIT Hospital.

openHouse.name: Job Fair
openHouse.description: Connects students and alumni with employers; facilitates career exploration and development.

communityService.description: Mandatory for undergraduates; projects include school assistance, rainwater harvesting, poverty elimination, waste management aligned with UN SDGs.

alumniPlacementCell.description: Maintains alumni records; bridges students with industry via on‑campus interviews, 'Window to Industry' lectures; supported by Career Counselors and Internship Officers.

boys.summers: Formal trousers/jeans with shirts or T‑shirts; no shorts, sleeveless or ripped garments; Shalwar kameez with waist coat and sandals on Fridays.
boys.winters: Blazers, jerseys, coats, jackets, scarves; no shawls.

girls.summers: Shalwar kameez, trousers or jeans with scarf/dupatta/abaya; knee‑length tops; no sleeveless, tights or indecent attire; closed shoes.
girls.winters: Blazers, jerseys, coats, jackets, scarves, shawls.

notes: University ID cards must be displayed during working hours
Dress code violations are subject to fine

achievements: 1st in Stick Bridge/Eiffel Tower/Paper Plane modules
Won Scrap Tech and Water Rocket events
Won Poster Designing and Design IT (AutoCAD)

studentAchievements.event: All Punjab Sultan Bahu Declamation Contest

hitecOlympiad.description: Interuniversity competition started in 2015 with 22 events and 24 universities; by 2020 hosted 58 modules and 50 universities.
